<DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
  <P align=center><img border=0 src="exhibit99-1header.jpg"></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B>CAUTIONARY NOTE TO U.S. INVESTORS CONCERNING
RESOURCE ESTIMATES AND CIVIL LIABILITIES AND JUDGMENTS</B></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><I>Resource estimates</I></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">The resource estimates in this 
Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis were prepared in accordance with 
Regulation 43-101 adopted by the Canadian Securities Administrators. The 
requirements of Regulation 43-101 differ significantly from the requirements of 
the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;). In
this Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis, we use the terms 
&#8220;Measured,&#8221; &#8220;Indicated&#8221; and &#8220;Inferred&#8221; 
Resources; although these terms are recognized and required to be used in 
Canada, the SEC does not recognize them. The SEC permits U.S. mining 
corporations, in their filings with the SEC, to disclose only those mineral 
deposits that constitute &#8220;reserves.&#8221; Under United States standards, 
mineralization may not be classified as a reserve unless the determination has 
been made that the mineralization could be economically and legally extracted at
the time the determination is made. United States investors should not assume 
that all or any portion of a Measured or Indicated Resource will ever be 
converted into &#8220;reserves.&#8221; Furthermore, &#8220;Inferred 
Resources&#8221; have a great amount of uncertainty as to their existence and 
whether they can be mined economically or legally, and United States investors 
should not assume that &#8220;Inferred Resources&#8221; exist or can be legally 
or economically mined, or that they will ever be upgraded to a more certain 
category.</P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><I>Potential unenforceability of civil 
liabilities and judgments</I></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">The Corporation is incorporated under the laws 
of the Province of Quebec, Canada. All of the Corporation's directors and 
officers as well as the experts named in the Form 20-F are residents of Canada. 
Also, all of the Corporation's assets and most of the assets of these persons 
are located outside of the United States. As a result, it may be difficult for 
shareholders to initiate a lawsuit within the United States against these non-
U.S. residents, or to enforce U.S. judgments against the Corporation or these 
persons. The Corporation's Canadian counsel has advised the Corporation that a 
monetary judgment of a U.S. court predicated solely upon the civil liability 
provisions of U.S. federal securities laws would likely be enforceable in Canada
if the U.S. court in which the judgment was obtained had a basis for 
jurisdiction in the matter that was recognized by a Canadian court for such 
purposes. This result may not always be the case. It is less certain that an 
action could be brought in Canada in the first instance on the basis of 
liability predicated solely upon such laws.</P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><I>As a &#8220;foreign private issuer&#8221;, 
the Corporation is exempt from the Section 14 proxy rules and Section 16 of the 
U.S. Securitie</I><I>s Exchange Act of 1934 and this may result in shareholders 
having less complete and timely data.</I></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">The submission of proxy and annual meeting of 
shareholder information (prepared to Canadian standards) on Form 6-K may result 
in shareholders having less complete and timely data. The exemption from Section
16 rules regarding sales of common shares by insiders may result in shareholders
having less data in this regard.</P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><I>Compliance with Canadian Securities 
Regulations</I></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">This quarterly report is intended to comply 
with the requirements of the Toronto Stock Exchange and applicable Canadian 
securities legislation, which differ in certain respects from the rules and 
regulations promulgated under the United States Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
as amended (&#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;), as promulgated by the SEC.</P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">U.S. investors are urged to consider the 
disclosure in our annual report on Form 20-F, File No. 001-14598, as filed with 
the SEC under the Exchange Act, which may be obtained from us (without cost) or 
from the SEC&#8217;s website: http://sec.gov/edgar.shtml.</P>
    <P style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</P>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><B><FONT color=#3d6367>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED 
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">Three-month periods ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 
(in thousands of Canadian dollars) (Unaudited)</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>1.</B></TD>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>General information and compliance with 
IFRS</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">Richmont Mines Inc. (&#8220;the 
Corporation&#8221;) is incorporated under the Business Corporations Act (Quebec)
and is engaged in mining, exploration and development of mining properties, 
principally gold.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">These interim consolidated 
financial statements have been prepared by the Corporation&#8217;s management in
accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards 
(&#8220;IFRS&#8221;), as established by the International Accounting Standards 
Board and in accordance with IAS 34 &#8220;Interim Financial Reporting&#8221;. 
They do not include all the information required in annual consolidated 
financial statements in accordance with IFRS. These interim consolidated 
financial statements must be read in conjunction with the audited consolidated 
financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2015.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">The preparation of interim 
consolidated financial statements in accordance with IAS 34 requires the use of 
certain critical accounting estimates. It also requires management to exercise 
judgment when applying the Corporation&#8217;s accounting policies.</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="96%"></TD></TR>

<BR>
<A name="page_10"></A><BR>
<a name="_bclPageBorder10"></a><DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
<P align=center>
<IMG border=0 src="exhibit99-1header.jpg"></P><BR>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>5.</B></TD>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>Share-based compensation</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="92%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B></B></TD>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B>a)</B></TD>
<TD width="92%" noWrap align=left><B>Share option 
plans</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">In effect since May 2012, the 
Corporation&#8217;s long-term incentive plan (the &#8220;New Plan&#8221;) 
permits the granting of options, restricted share units (&#8220;RSUs&#8221;), 
share appreciation rights (&#8220;SARs&#8221;) and retention awards 
(&#8220;Retention Awards&#8221;) to directors, officers, other employees, 
consultants and service providers providing ongoing services to the 
Corporation.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">The current policy of the 
Corporation is to set the exercise price of each option granted at the market 
price at closing of the Corporation&#8217;s stock on the Toronto Stock Exchange,
on the day prior the day of grant. Vesting is set at one third one year after 
the grant date, one third on the second anniversary of the grant date, and one 
third on the third anniversary of the grant date, with expiry of the option five
years after the date of grant. In previous years, options vested as above or in 
tranches of 20% beginning one year after the grant date, thereafter vesting 
cumulatively on every anniversary date over a period of four years, and expiring
six years after the date of grant; or options that vested 20% on the grant date 
and vested cumulatively thereafter on every anniversary date over a period of 
four years, and expiring five years after the date of grant; or options that 
vested on August 8, 2016 and expiring five years after the date of grant; or 
options that vested 100% on the grant date and expiring five years after the 
date of grant.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">A summary of the status of 
options outstanding under the Corporation&#8217;s New Plan at June 30, 2016 and 
changes during the three-month and six-month periods then ended, is presented 
below:</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%"

<table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%"

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">During the six-month period 
ended June 30, 2016, the Corporation granted 360,000 share options to a 
director, an officer and employees (205,000 to directors and employees for the 
six-month period ended June 30, 2015). The weighted average fair value of these 
share options at the grant date, calculated using the Black-Scholes option 
pricing model was $3.36 ($2.01 for the six-month period ended June 30, 
2015).</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">The Corporation had a Stock 
Option Purchase Plan (the &#8220;Initial Plan&#8221;) under which options to 
acquire common shares were granted to its directors, officers, employees and 
non-employees. The exercise price of each option was determined by the market 
price of the Corporation&#8217;s stock on the Toronto Stock Exchange, on the day
prior to the grant, and the maximum term of the options granted was ten years. 
20% of the options were vested on the grant date and vested cumulatively
thereafter on every anniversary date over a period of four years. The 
Corporation ended the Initial Plan in 2012. Outstanding options that were issued
under this previous plan, will continue to have the same terms and conditions as
when they were initially issued.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">A summary of the status of 
options outstanding under the Corporation&#8217;s Initial Plan at June 30, 2016 
and changes during the three-month and six-month periods then ended, is 
presented below:</P>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">The following table summarizes 
information about the options issued under the Corporation&#8217;s Initial Plan 
at June 30, 2016:</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 8%"></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 22%"></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 14%"></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 14%"></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 14%"></TD>

<P style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="92%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B>b)</B></TD>
<TD width="92%" noWrap align=left><B>Restricted share 
units</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">The Corporation&#8217;s New Plan
permits the granting of RSUs. Upon vesting, each RSU is exchanged for one common
share of the Corporation. The fair value of each RSU is equal to the fair value 
of one common share of the Corporation at the date of grant. The fair value is 
amortized over the vesting period of three years. Two types of RSUs are issued: 
(1) RSUs that vest in thirds one year after the grant date, then vest 
cumulatively thereafter on every anniversary date over a total period of three 
years, (2) RSUs that fully vest at the earliest of three years after the grant 
date or upon the Director leaving the Board.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">A summary of the status of RSUs
outstanding under the Corporation&#8217;s New Plan at June 30, 2016 and changes 
during the three-month and six-month periods then ended, is presented below:</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%"

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">During the six-month period 
ended June 30, 2016, the Corporation granted 265,180 RSUs to officers and 
employees at an average fair value of $6.32 (none in the comparable period of 
2015).</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="92%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B>c)</B></TD>
<TD width="92%" noWrap align=left><B>Deferred share 
units</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">In May 2015, the Corporation 
established a deferred share unit (DSU) plan for directors. The value of an 
outstanding DSU, on any particular date, is equal to the market value of a 
common share of the Corporation at such date. DSUs are granted to directors and 
must be retained until the director leaves the Corporation&#8217;s Board of 
Directors (Board), at which time, the Board elects one or any combination of the
following payment methods: (a) issuing common shares from treasury, (b) purchase
shares on the market or (c) paying cash. If the Board does not elect for the 
payment method, the obligation is automatically settled in cash.</P>
<table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing=0 border=0>
    <tr>
      <td width="50%"></td>
      <td width="50%"></td>
    </tr>
    <tr valign=bottom>
      <td style="BORDER-TOP: #df9e1e 1px solid" nowrap align=left><font 
color=#3d6367>RICHMONT MINES INC.</font></td>
      <td style="BORDER-TOP: #df9e1e 1px solid" nowrap align=right><font 
color=#3d6367>REPORT TO SHAREHOLDERS Q2 2016 </font><font color=#df9e1e>| 
</font><font color=#3d6367>Page 37</font></td>
    </tr>
  </table>
<P style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</P></DIV><BR>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" align=center SIZE=1 width="100%" noShade>
<BR>
<A name="page_13"></A><BR>
<a name="_bclPageBorder13"></a><DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
<P align=center>
<IMG border=0 src="exhibit99-1header.jpg"></P><BR>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">DSU&#8217;s are initially 
measured on the grant date at fair value and recognized as an obligation. The 
obligation is re -measured to fair value at each reporting date up to and 
including the settlement date, with changes in fair value recognized in the 
consolidated income statement. The Corporation values the obligation based on 
the market price at closing of the Corporation&#8217;s stock on the Toronto 
Stock Exchange.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">In the six-month period ended 
June 30, 2016, the Corporation granted 110,000 DSUs to directors (none in the 
comparable period of 2015) and recorded a compensation expense of $1,319 (none 
in 2015). As at June 30, 2016, 110,000 DSUs were outstanding (none as at 
December 31, 2015) for which the compensation liability was $1,319 (none as at 
December 31, 2015). Subsequent to the quarter&#8217;s end, the Corporation 
released 47,000 shares as payment for 47,000 DSU.</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="92%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B></B></TD>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B>d)</B></TD>
<TD width="92%" noWrap align=left><B>Retention 
awards</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">In March 2012, the Corporation 
signed agreements with several employees considered as key personnel. These 
agreements incorporate a retention payment (&#8220;Retention Awards&#8221;) 
provided certain conditions are met by the employee, most notably that the 
employee continues his or her employment with the Corporation until March 2017. 
These retention payments would be payable in 2017 in either of the 
Corporation&#8217;s common shares or cash, at the discretion of the employee, 
with the number of common shares to be determined by the current value of the 
common shares at the time of payment. As at June 30, 2016, the total amount that
could be paid as Retention Awards under these agreements is $1,750 and the 
liability accrued for to this effect amounts to $1,407 as at June 30, 2016 
($1,234 as at December 31, 2015), which corresponds to the best estimate of the 
amount to be paid relating to the Retention Awards, based on estimated 
forfeitures and a 1.3% discount rate.</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="92%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B></B></TD>
<TD width="4%" noWrap align=left><B>e)</B></TD>
<TD width="92%" noWrap align=left><B>Options outside the Corporation&#8217;s 
plan</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">In addition, 800,000 inducement 
options were granted on October 16, 2014 to the incoming CEO. In compliance with
TSX rules, these are considered outside of the Corporation&#8217;s plan. These
options vest in thirds on December 1<SUP>st</SUP>, 2015, and thereafter on 
December 1<SUP>st </SUP>2016 and 2017, and expire five years after the date of 
grant. These options have an exercise price of $2.46. As at June 30, 2016, all 
options are outstanding and 266,666 are exercisable.</P>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">During the six-month period 
ended on June 30, 2016, the Corporation acquired mobile equipment at a cost of 
$3,015 via two financial lease agreements. At the end of these contracts, the 
Corporation benefits from an option of a lower purchase price. Minimum lease 
payments amount to $338 for the remainder of 2016, $703 for 2017, $739 for 2018,
$777 for 2019 and $82 for 2020.</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>11.</B></TD>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>Asset retirement 
obligations</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">The Corporation&#8217;s 
production and exploration activities are subject to various federal and 
provincial laws and regulations governing the protection of the environment. 
These laws and regulations are continually changing and are generally becoming 
more restrictive. The Corporation conducts its operations so as to protect 
public health and the environment. The Corporation has recorded the asset 
retirement obligations of its mining sites on the basis of management&#8217;s 
best estimates of future costs, based on information available on the reporting 
date. Best estimates of future costs are the amount the Corporation would 
reasonably pay to settle its obligation on the closing date. Future costs are 
discounted using pre-tax rates that reflect current market assessments of the 
time value of money and the risks specific to the liability. Such estimates are 
subject to change based on modifications to laws and regulations or as new 
information becomes available.</P>
<table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing=0 border=0>
<tr>
      <td width="50%"></td>
      <td width="50%"></td>
    </tr>
    <tr valign=bottom>
      <td style="BORDER-TOP: #df9e1e 1px solid" nowrap align=left><font 
color=#3d6367>RICHMONT MINES INC.</font></td>
      <td style="BORDER-TOP: #df9e1e 1px solid" nowrap align=right><font 
color=#3d6367>REPORT TO SHAREHOLDERS Q2 2016 </font><font color=#df9e1e>|

    </tr>

<TD width="92%" noWrap align=left><B>Restricted deposits and letters of 
credit</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">As at June 30, 2016, the 
Corporation has $117 in restricted deposits with the Quebec government, $714 in 
restricted deposits with the Ontario government and a credit facility is 
available to the Corporation up to an amount of $5,900 for the issuance of 
letters of credit as guarantees for the settlement of asset retirement 
obligations. The credit facility has a fixed annual fee of 0.95% (0.95% in 
2015). The following table provides the allocation of restricted deposits and 
letters of credit issued as at June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015:</P>

width="2%" noWrap align=left>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%"><B>Issue of shares</B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">On June 7, 2016, the Corporation
issued a total of 2,990,000 common shares on a bought-deal basis through a 
syndicate of underwriters, at a price of $10.40 per share. This included the 
entire over-allotment option of 390,000 common shares, and generated aggregate 
gross proceeds of $31,096. Share issue costs of $2,002 were incurred relating to
the issuance of common shares. A deferred tax asset of $535 related to the share
issue cost was not recognised.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">During the six-month period 
ended on June 30, 2016, the Corporation issued 487,963 common shares following 
the exercise of stock options (129,220 during the six-month period ended on June
30, 2015) and received cash proceeds in the amount of $1,650 ($193 in the 
comparable period). Contributed surplus was reduced by $810 which represents the
recorded fair value of the exercised stock options ($86 in the comparable 
period).</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">During the six-month period 
ended on June 30, 2016, the Corporation issued 812,500 common shares following 
the exercise of warrants (none in the comparable period of 2015) and received 
cash proceeds in the amount of $1,990 and contributed surplus was reduced by 
$439.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">Finally, during the six-month 
period ended on June 30, 2016, the Corporation issued 59,731 common shares 
following the vesting of restricted share units (none in the comparable period 
of 2015). Contributed surplus was reduced by $224 which represents the recorded 
fair value of the restricted share units.</P>

cellspacing=0 border=0>
    <tr>
      <td width="50%"></td>

    </tr>

align=left>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #e6efff" width="2%" noWrap 
align=left>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD style="WIDTH: 4%" align=left>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 40%" align=left>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 8%; TEXT-INDENT: -4%">Change in payables, accruals and
provisions related to&nbsp;property, plant and equipment</P></TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="12%" noWrap 
align=right><B>2,399</B></TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="2%" noWrap 
align=right>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="12%" noWrap 
align=right>1,633</TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="2%" noWrap 
align=left>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="12%" noWrap 
align=right><B>(1,703</B></TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="2%" noWrap 
align=left><B>)</B></TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="12%" noWrap 
align=right>(198</TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" width="2%" noWrap 
align=left>)</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>14.</B></TD>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>Segmented information</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">The Corporation operates gold 
mines at different sites in Quebec and Ontario. These operating sites are 
managed separately given their different locations. The Corporation assesses the
performance of each segment based on earnings before taxes. Accounting policies 
for each segment are the same as those used for the preparation of the 
consolidated financial statements.</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">There was no difference in 2016 
compared to annual financial statements of 2015 on the basis of segmentation or 
the basis of evaluation of segmented results.</P>
<table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing=0 border=0>
    <tr>
      <td width="50%"></td>
      <td width="50%"></td>
    </tr>
    <tr valign=bottom>
      <td style="BORDER-TOP: #df9e1e 1px solid" nowrap align=left><font 
color=#3d6367>RICHMONT MINES INC.</font></td>
      <td style="BORDER-TOP: #df9e1e 1px solid" nowrap align=right><font 
color=#3d6367>REPORT TO SHAREHOLDERS Q2 2016 </font><font color=#df9e1e>| 
</font><font color=#3d6367>Page 43</font></td>
    </tr>
  </table>
<P style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</P></DIV><BR>

<IMG border=0 src="exhibit99-1header.jpg"></P><BR>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>15.</B></TD>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>Contingency</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">On July 20, 2016, an agreement 
was signed between the Corporation and a supplier to settle a dispute related to
costs stemming from work that the Corporation had not previously authorized. The
agreement, in the amount of $150, effectively ended an arbitration process. A 
provision for this amount has been accounted for in the financial statements in 
this respect.</P>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD width="4%"></TD>
<TD width="96%"></TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>16.</B></TD>
<TD noWrap align=left><B>Approval of Financial 
Statements</B></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">The interim consolidated 
financial statements for the period ending June 30, 2016 were approved for 
publication by the Board of Directors on August 4, 2016.</P>

cellspacing=0 border=0>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman';font-size: 10pt;">
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=3 margin=0>
<div align="right"><strong>Exhibit 99.2</strong></div>
<a name="_bclPageBorder1"></a>
<DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><B>FORM 52-109F2<BR>
    CERTIFICATION OF INTERIM FILINGS<BR>
    </B><B>FULL CERTIFICATE OF RICHMONT MINES INC.</B></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">I, Renaud Adams, President and Chief Executive 
Office of Richmont Mines Inc., certify the following:</P>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="96%"><P align=justify><B><I>Review: </I></B>I have reviewed the
interim financial report and interim MD&amp;A (together, the &#8220;interim 
filings&#8221;) of Richmont Mines Inc. (the &#8220;issuer&#8221;) for the 
interim period ended June 30, 2016.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I></I></B>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>2.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>No misrepresentations: 
</I></B>Based on my knowledge, having exercised reasonable diligence, the 
interim filings do not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit
to state a material fact required to be stated or that is necessary to make a 
statement not misleading in light of the circumstances under which it was made, 
with respect to the period covered by the interim filings.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I></I></B>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>3.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>Fair presentation: </I></B>Based on
my knowledge, having exercised reasonable diligence, the interim financial 
report together with the other financial information included in the interim 
filings fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, 
financial performance and cash flows of the issuer, as of the date of and for 
the periods presented in the interim filings.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I></I></B>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>4.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>Responsibility: </I></B>The 
issuer&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing 
and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (DC&amp;P) and internal 
control over financial reporting (ICFR), as those terms are defined in 
Regulation 52-109 respecting Certification of Disclosure in Issuers&#8217; 
Annual and Interim Filings (c. V-1.1, r. 27), for the issuer.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I></I></B>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>5.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>Design: </I></B>Subject to the 
limitations, if any, described in paragraphs 5.2 and 5.3, the issuer&#8217;s 
other certifying officer and I have, as at the end of the period covered by the 
interim filings</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I></I></B>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify>designed DC&amp;P, or caused it to be 
designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance that</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify></P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
<TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify>material information relating to the 
issuer is made known to us by others, particularly during the period in which 
the interim filings are being prepared; and</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify></P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify>information required to be disclosed by 
the issuer in its annual filings, interim filings or other reports filed or 
submitted by it under securities legislation is recorded, processed, summarized 
and reported within the time periods specified in securities legislation; 
and</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify></P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify>designed ICFR, or caused it to be 
designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the 
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with the issuer&#8217;s GAAP.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <DIV align=left>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>5.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="96%"><P align=justify><B><I>Control framework: </I></B>The 
control framework the issuer&#8217;s other certifying officer and I used to 
design the issuer&#8217;s ICFR is &#171; <I>Integrated Framework (COSO 
Framework) </I>published by <I>The </I><I>Committee of Sponsoring Organizations 
of the Treadway Commission (COSO) </I>&#187;.</P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  </DIV>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">1</P>

  <DIV align=left>
    <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellSpacing=0 border=0>
      <TR>
        <TD width="4%"></TD>
        <TD width="96%"></TD>
      </TR>
      <TR vAlign=bottom>
        <TD width="4%" noWrap align=left>5.2 </TD>
        <TD width="96%" noWrap align=left>&nbsp;<STRONG><EM>ICFR &#8211; 
material weakness relating to design: </EM></STRONG>N/A</TD>
      </TR>
      <TR vAlign=bottom>

      <TR vAlign=bottom>
        <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap align=left>6.</TD>
        <TD style="text-align:justify"; vAlign=top width="96%" 
align=left><B><I>Reporting changes in ICFR: </I></B>The issuer has disclosed in 
its interim MD&amp;A any change in the issuer&#8217;s ICFR that occurred during 
the period beginning on April 1<SUP>st</SUP>, 2016 and ended on June 30, 2016 
that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the 
issuer&#8217;s ICFR.</TD>
      </TR>

<TYPE>EX-99.3

<DESCRIPTION>FORM 52-109F2 CERTIFICATION OF INTERIM FILINGS - CFO
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Exhibit 99.3</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman';font-size: 10pt;">
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=3 margin=0>
<div align="right"><strong>Exhibit 99.3</strong></div>
<a name="_bclPageBorder1"></a>
<DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><B>FORM 52-109F2<BR>
    CERTIFICATION OF INTERIM FILINGS<BR>
    </B><B>FULL CERTIFICATE OF RICHMONT MINES INC.</B></P>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">I, Nicole Veilleux, Vice-President, Finance of 
Richmont Mines Inc., in capacity of &#8220;Chief Financial Officer&#8221;, 
certify the following:</P>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="96%"><P align=justify><B><I>Review: </I></B>I have reviewed the
interim financial report and interim MD&amp;A (together, the &#8220;interim 
filings&#8221;) of Richmont Mines Inc. (the &#8220;issuer&#8221;) for the 
interim period ended June 30, 2016.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>2.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>No misrepresentations: 
</I></B>Based on my knowledge, having exercised reasonable diligence, the 
interim filings do not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit 
to state a material fact required to be stated or that is necessary to make a 
statement not misleading in light of the circumstances under which it was made, 
with respect to the period covered by the interim filings.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>&nbsp; </I></B></P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>3.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>Fair presentation: </I></B>Based on
my knowledge, having exercised reasonable diligence, the interim financial 
report together with the other financial information included in the interim 
filings fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, 
financial performance and cash flows of the issuer, as of the date of and for 
the periods presented in the interim filings.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>4.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>Responsibility: </I></B>The 
issuer&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing 
and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (DC&amp;P) and internal 
control over financial reporting (ICFR), as those terms are defined in 
Regulation 52-109 respecting Certification of Disclosure in Issuers&#8217; 
Annual and Interim Filings (c. V-1.1, r. 27), for the issuer.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
<TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>Design: </I></B>Subject to the 
limitations, if any, described in paragraphs 5.2 and 5.3, the issuer&#8217;s 
other certifying officer and I have, as at the end of the period covered by the 
interim filings</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="2%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD width="98%"><P align=justify><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify>designed DC&amp;P, or caused it to be 
designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance that</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify></P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify>material information relating to the 
issuer is made known to us by others, particularly during the period in which 
the interim filings are being prepared; and</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify></P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify>information required to be disclosed by 
the issuer in its annual filings, interim filings or other reports filed or 
submitted by it under securities legislation is recorded, processed, summarized 
and reported within the time periods specified in securities legislation; 
and</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="8%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
      <TD width="88%"><P align=justify></P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0 
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BACKGROUND:
none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: 
medium none" vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify>designed ICFR, or caused it to be 
designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the 
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with the issuer&#8217;s GAAP.</P></TD>
    </TR>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap></TD>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
      <TD width="92%"><P align=justify>&nbsp; </P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  <DIV align=left>
    <TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'" cellSpacing=0
width="100%" border=0>
    <TR>
      <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap>5.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
      <TD width="96%"><P align=justify><B><I>Control framework: </I></B>The 
control framework the issuer&#8217;s other certifying officer and I used to 
design the issuer&#8217;s ICFR is &#171; <I>Integrated Framework (COSO 
Framework) </I>published by <I>The </I><I>Committee of Sponsoring Organizations 
of the Treadway Commission (COSO) </I>&#187;.</P></TD>
    </TR>
  </TABLE>
  </DIV>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">1</P>
</DIV>

      <TR>
        <TD width="4%"></TD>
        <TD width="96%"></TD>
      </TR>
      <TR vAlign=bottom>
        <TD width="4%" noWrap align=left>5.2 </TD>
        <TD width="96%" noWrap align=left><STRONG><EM>ICFR &#8211; material 
weakness relating to design: </EM></STRONG>N/A</TD>
      </TR>
      <TR vAlign=bottom>
        <TD width="4%" noWrap align=left></TD>
        <TD width="96%" noWrap align=left><STRONG><EM>&nbsp;</EM></STRONG></TD>
      </TR>
      <TR vAlign=bottom>
        <TD width="4%" noWrap align=left>5.3 </TD>
        <TD width="96%" noWrap align=left><STRONG><EM>Limitation on scope of 
design: </EM></STRONG>N/A</TD>
      </TR>
      <TR vAlign=bottom>
        <TD width="4%" noWrap align=left></TD>
        <TD width="96%" noWrap align=left><STRONG><EM>&nbsp;</EM></STRONG></TD>
      </TR>
      <TR vAlign=bottom>
        <TD vAlign=top width="4%" noWrap align=left>6.</TD>
        <TD style="text-align:justify"; vAlign=top width="96%" 
align=left><B><I>Reporting changes in ICFR: </I></B>The issuer has disclosed in
its interim MD&amp;A any change in the issuer&#8217;s ICFR that occurred during 
the period beginning on April 1<SUP>st</SUP>, 2016 and ended on June 30, 2016 
that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the 
issuer&#8217;s ICFR.</TD>
      </TR>
    </TABLE>
  </DIV>
  <P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Date: August 8, 2016</P>
